intro: Cyperus anceps, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a flowering plant in the sedge family, Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along waterways. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 100 centimeters and has a fibrous root system. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems and a common ornamental plant in water gardens.
